instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hello, the macbook chargers battery, orange/green light works.

It had corroded cap with track: <CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR> 1 pin. this place restored, changed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but still same situation.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present.

where should check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: i have found that signal <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> shorts to ground. i am confused how to find short as this voltage goes to so many components.. Please advice to find short cause.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Inject 3V on that line and see what heats up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: nothing exact, all board becomes a bit warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Use lips to detect heat. How much current is being pulled at 3V?
